name: customize-toolbar
description: Add custom buttons to the toolbar

CustomizeToolbar.buttonConfig.markdownDescription:
Go to `settings.json` to configure the toolbar buttons. 

 After the changes, you need to restart VSCode twice as prompted. 

 If the actual display doesn't match the configuration file due to plugin update or other unknown reasons, you can execute `Customize Toolbar: Refresh` in the [command palette](command:workbench.action.showCommands) ( or simply click this button: [[REFRESH]](command:customize-toolbar.refresh) ).

name.markdownDescription: **(Required)** The name of the button to display on hover.

icon.markdownDescription:
**(Required)** The icon of the button. 

 **A.** A theme icon reference, like 

 `"zap"` 

 (see [official doc](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/icons-in-labels#icon-listing) and extension [Octicons Refsrc](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=liangruliu.octicons-refsrc) 

 **B.** An object with absolute paths for light and dark themes, like 

 `{ "light": ".../a.svg", "dark": ".../b.svg" }` 

 (use `builtin` to represent the root directory of this plugin's built-in icons.)

command_vscode.markdownDescription:
**(Exclusive)** The VSCode command executed by pressing the button. 

 Note that you need to fill in the **identifier** instead of the name. Specific information can be found in the [keyboard shortcut list](command:workbench.action.openGlobalKeybindings). 

 For example, to expand or retract the terminal, write `workbench.action.terminal.toggleTerminal` instead of `view.toggleTerminal`.

command_terminal.markdownDescription:
**(Exclusive)** The terminal command executed by pressing the button. 

 Variables are substituted based on the context: 

 + `$path` : full path of current file
 + `$dir` : path of the folder that current file is contained in
 + `$name` : current file's name
 + `$stem` : current file's name without extension
 + `$workspace` : path of the workspace (if exists)
 + `$relative` : path of current file relative to the workspace

when.markdownDescription:
**(Optional)** If a regular expression is given, the button will be displayed only if the filename matches it. 

 For example: `"^(?:.*.txt|txt.md)$"` matches files with a ".txt" file extension or a "txt.md" file name; `"^.*(?<!.txt)$"` matches files with a file extension other than ".txt".
